TextSection.Contents: Type II xanthinuria, a type of classical xanthinuria (see this term), is a rare autosomal recessive disorder of purine metabolism (see this term) characterized by the deficiency of both xanthine dehydrogenase and aldehyde oxidase, leading to the formation of urinary xanthine urolithiasis and leading, in some patients, to kidney failure. Other less common manifestations include arthropathy, myopathy and duodenal ulcer, while some patients remain asymptomatic.

Name.label: E (exact mapping (the terms and the concepts are equivalent))

Synonym.label: Xanthine dehydrogenase and xanthine aldehyde oxidase dual deficiency
